definition: canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
dictionary/also written 辭典|辞典[ci2 dian3]/CL:部[bu4],本[ben3]
Chinese character dictionary (containing entries for single characters, contrasted with a 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3], which has entries for words of one or more characters)/(coll.) dictionary/CL:本[ben3]

sentences.english: I very much want to buy the English dictionary, but unfortunately Idon't have enough money on me.
sentences.chinese: 我很想買這本英書契典，遺憾的是我身上帶的錢不夠。

sentences.english: The teaching method of those famous professors is always quotes .
sentences.chinese: 名教授的授課方式從來都是引經論典的。

sentences.english: This is a new dictionary. I bought it yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 這是一本新詞高考資源網典，我昨天買的。

sentences.english: The powers and duties are confered on the tribunal by the statutory code.
sentences.chinese: 成文法典賦於法庭權力與責任。

sentences.english: Scientists hope to break through soon in their fight against SARS.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們在與非典的鬥爭中希望不久有重大成果。

sentences.english: Distress allusion begins to assume a responsibility that takes care of cattail, day after day.
sentences.chinese: 悲痛的典開始承擔起照顧蒲的責任，日復一日。

sentences.english: Which is the most unforgettable movie for you?
sentences.chinese: 哪一部典的愛情電影讓你畢生難忘？

sentences.english: Most of us scholars believe that these letters are pseudonymous.
sentences.chinese: 大多學者認爲這些書信是僞典。

sentences.english: We believe they are pseudepigrapha; remember this from before?
sentences.chinese: 我們相信它們是冒名僞典，記得嗎？

sentences.english: Jack sang us a pop song at the party .
sentences.chinese: 傑克在晚會上給我們唱了一首流行歌典。

definition: to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
